• Price $25

• The [thing=102548][b][i]Dungeon Fighter[/i][/b][/thing] base game, along with the [thing=144386][b][i]Fire at Will[/i][/b][/thing] and [thing=163169][b][i]Stormy Winds[/i][/b][/thing] expansions, will also be available at Gen Con 2015. Now you can collect everything at one time and have no room in your luggage for anything else!

• Debuting at Gen Con 2015 (in this version of the game).

• Price $15

• Debuting at Gen Con 2015 (at least with this version of the game).

• Price $40

• Debuting at Gen Con 2015.

• Price $0 — but the challenge is in finding where to acquire one. To do that, you need to track down Chevee Dodd at Gen Con 2015 and ask for a copy. Dodd gave away one hundred copies of [thing=162249][i]Me Booty![/i][/thing] at Gen Con 2014, so he might have roughly that many copies of this new release. We won't know for sure until we track him down in Indy!

• Price discounted to $20 for Gen Con 2015.

• Jeff Cornelius of Cosmic Wombat Games says, "We will have a free bonus pack with purchase ($5 value)."
• Available for demo games at Gen Con 2015 ahead of a Kickstarter funding campaign due to launch in August 2015.

• Available for a few demo games at Gen Con 2015, but as Stonemaier's Jamey Stegmaier explains "only on Thursday night from 8-11 p.m. in the Denver room of the Marriott if people 'pay' a $0 ticket and if there is room for them. (Technically it's a sold-out event, so if it gets too crowded, we'll have to turn people away.)" Okay, your chance of hitting this event might be slim, but [i]Between Two Cities[/i] will be demoed in advance of its release, so onto this preview it goes. Gotta catch 'em all!

• Note that Stonemaier will have themed game nights each day of the show in this room, but I believe that [i]Between Two Cities[/i] is the only new or upcoming title being shown there.

• Playable only as an event at Gen Con 2015 (GameID BGM1582721 — Saturday, 6-11 p.m.), and available only on a preview basis ahead of the game's release in October 2015. Yes, this is a Spiel 2015 preview from a Finnish publisher. We'll have Finns at Gen Con! Well, at least one Finn. It's interesting to see how international this fair has become in just a couple of years!

• Brotherwise notes that it will have the limited edition version of [i]Boss Monster 2: The Next Level[/i] available for sale at Gen Con 2015. In more detail:

[q]The Limited Edition of [i]Boss Monster 2: The Next Level[/i] includes all 160 new cards that the retail version has, plus a limited edition sleeve with all new art work and 15 holofoil cards, including foil versions of all the Bosses included in the game.[/q]
On top of that, Brotherwise says, "We'll also have a special Boss promo card available at the booth that you can get using the coupon on the back cover of the coupon book!"

• Notes Brandan Parsons from BOG: "We will include the [thing=166695][b][i]Wakanda: Three Little Coyotes[/i][/b][/thing] expansion free for the first fifty people who buy the base game", which is discounted for Gen Con 2015 to $20.

[center][ImageID=2255553 medium][/center]

[floatright][ImageID=2564267][/floatright]• Available for previewing in the GreenBrier Games booth (2437) at Gen Con 2015. I'm not sure whether GreenBrier is now publishing this title or merely offering space, but I'm asking for details to know for sure.
• Available for previewing at Gen Con 2015 ahead of its retail release before the end of the year.

Based on this sentence, I'm not exactly sure whether the promo is free for those who demo the game, but if you don't have [i]The Dark Titan[/i], then this card won't do you much good anyway...

• Designer/publisher Gil Hova says, "Formal Ferret staff and I will be demoing and taking preorders for my party game at Gen Con. The game's scheduled release date is September 2015, although it might be available sooner. Will it be available at Gen Con? Depends on if I'm able to fulfill to backers around then. The Magic 8 Ball is murky..."

• Available for demo games at Gen Con 2015. Notes designer/publisher Gil Hova, "I'll be demoing my newest game in advance of its planned September 1, 2015 Kickstarter launch. I should have most, if not all, of Heiko Günther's and Travis Kinchy's art by then. The actual hours in which I'll be running these demos is TBD."

• Demo games take place at booth 2827 (Indie Game Alliance) and the First Exposure Playtest Hall.

• Hova adds that "extra goodies like foam dice, Formal Ferret T-shirts, and a few titles from Minion Games" will also be sold here since Minion doesn't have its own booth at Gen Con 2015.

Marriott on Wednesday after mid-day and late Sunday."

body: • Debuted at BGG.CON 2014 in very limited amounts, but now available for general release.

• FoxMind Games doesn't have a stand at Gen Con 2015, but designer Andy Geremia is running five events during the con — [url=http://www.cerealboxmaze.com/gencon]details on his website[/url] — as well as a seminar on how he managed to license this design. You can also contact him via Twitter (@MazeRacers) to arrange a meeting/demo time at Gen Con 2015. Adds Geremia, "We will also tweet when we will be in the 'Pick-Up Play Area' (a.k.a. Open Gaming), Rooms 101-106 of the Convention Center".
[center][ImageID=2498405 medium][/center]
